results.headline: Married and on the Make, Even After a Heart Attack
results.summary_short: This French comedy concerns a man who has had a heart attack and yet continues with his philandering ways.

results.headline: The Quest for Storybook Endings in a Scary but Magical World
results.summary_short: “Into the Woods,” Rob Marshall’s Disney screen adaptation of the Stephen Sondheim-James Lapine musical, is a mash-up of Grimm fairy tales viewed through a post-Freudian prism.

results.headline: A 50-Mile March, Nearly 50 Years Later
results.summary_short: Ava DuVernay’s film “Selma” follows civil rights demonstrators in March 1965 across an Alabama bridge and into a new era for black Americans, with progress made and promises unkept.

results.headline: Life: Poor, Nasty, Brutish and (Probably) Short

results.headline: An Artist Overlooked in Plain Sight
